org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class RandomKeyStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.RandomKeyStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeySource<ByteArrayKey>

    public class RandomKeyStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
    A source of keys filled with pseudo-random values. Keys are generated as requested. This class uses the ISAAC pseudo-random number generator (see http://burtleburtle.net/bob/rand/isaacafa.htm).
    Author:
    David Curtis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomKeyStream(int keySize, long seed, int limit)
      Creates a source of random keys.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ByteArrayKey getKey()
      Returns a key filled with generated pseudo-random values, or null if the limit for generated keys has been reached.
      int getKeyCount()
      Returns the value specified in the limit parameter for the constructor RandomKeyStream(int, long, int).
      int getKeySizeHint()
      Returns the value specified in the keySize parameter for the constructor RandomKeyStream(int, long, int).
      boolean hasMoreKeys()
      Returns true if more keys are available from this source.
      void reset()
      Resets the state of the source to the state that existed immediately after initialization.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomKeyStream

        public RandomKeyStream(int keySize,
               long seed,
               int limit)
        Creates a source of random keys.
        Parameters:
        keySize - size of keys returned by getKey()
        seed - initializing value for the pseudo-random number generator
        limit - the number of keys generated before hasMoreKeys returns false

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public ByteArrayKey getKey()
        Returns a key filled with generated pseudo-random values, or null if the limit for generated keys has been reached. The size of the returned key is the value of the keySize parameter for the constructor RandomKeyStream(int, long, int).
        Specified by:
        getKey in interface KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
        Returns:
        next available key, or null if none is available
        See Also:
        org.logicmill.hash.test.KeySource#getKey()

      • hasMoreKeys

        public boolean hasMoreKeys()
        Returns true if more keys are available from this source. In general, test programs using key sources should follow this pattern: 
        
 while (source.hasMoreKeys()) {
        byte[] key = source.getKey();
        //... use key ...
 }
        Specified by:
        hasMoreKeys in interface KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
        Returns:
        true if keys are available
        See Also:
        org.logicmill.hash.test.KeySource#hasMoreKeys()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the state of the source to the state that existed immediately after initialization. Precise meaning may vary among source implementations.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
        See Also:
        org.logicmill.hash.test.KeySource#reset()

      • getKeySizeHint

        public int getKeySizeHint()
        Returns the value specified in the keySize parameter for the constructor RandomKeyStream(int, long, int).
        Specified by:
        getKeySizeHint in interface KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
        Returns:
        the maximum expected size of a key from this source
        See Also:
        org.logicmill.hash.test.KeySource#getKeySizeHint()

      • getKeyCount

        public int getKeyCount()
        Returns the value specified in the limit parameter for the constructor RandomKeyStream(int, long, int).
        Specified by:
        getKeyCount in interface KeySource<ByteArrayKey>
        Returns:
        number of keys available at initialization, or -1 if unknown
        See Also:
        org.logicmill.hash.test.KeySource#getKeyCount()
